org.forgerock.openidm.maintenance.upgrade

Class BundleHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openidm.maintenance.upgrade.BundleHandler

  • public class BundleHandler
extends Object
    Designed to use the systemBundle from the OSGI framework to handle the actions that can be taken on a Bundle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BundleHandler(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext systemBundleContext, String archiveExtension, LogHandler updateLogger)
      Construct a BundleHandler

      Stop a currently running bundle.

      Uninstall a currently installed bundle.
      void updateBundle(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)

      void upgradeBundle(Path newBundle, String symbolicName)
      Upgrades a Bundle by removing the old Bundle if it is installed and replacing it with the new.

      • BundleHandler

        public BundleHandler(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext systemBundleContext,
                     String archiveExtension,
                     LogHandler updateLogger)
        Construct a BundleHandler
        Parameters:
        systemBundleContext - the BundleContext of the system bundle
        archiveExtension - the extension used with backing up existing files
        updateLogger - the logger used to record bundle changes

    • Method Detail

      • upgradeBundle

        public void upgradeBundle(Path newBundle,
                          String symbolicName)
                   throws UpdateException
        Upgrades a Bundle by removing the old Bundle if it is installed and replacing it with the new. If the new Bundle has not been installed in the framework it will install it.
        Parameters:
        newBundle - Bundle to install in the Felix framework.
        symbolicName - is the key used to look up installed bundles in the Felix framework.
        Throws:
        UpdateException

      • updateBundle

        public void updateBundle(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
                  throws UpdateException
        Update a current installed bundle.
        Parameters:
        bundle - that will be updated
        Throws:
        UpdateException
